de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.io
Class XMLTestDataCollection

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.io.XMLTestDataCollection

public class XMLTestDataCollection
extends java.lang.Object

This class has the job of saving the generated test data collection as a physical XML file to the file system. Do accomplish this, the class makes use of the JDOM technology. That means, the whole collection is build in-memory before it is serialized. A backdraw of this approach is, of course, the intensive use of memory. The more test data to save the memory assumptions. A better approach would be to save each test data separate at the time when created, but this isn't straightforward.

JDOM
JDOM is open source, tree-based and pure Java for parsing, creating, manipulating and serializing XML documents. Like DOM it represents XML documents as a tree composed of elements, attributes, comments, text nodes and so forth. JDOM can access any part of the tree at any time. All kinds of nodes in the tree are represented by concrete classes rather than interfaces.

JDOM doesn't itself include a parser. Instead it depends on a SAX parser to parse documents and build JDOM models from them. Xerces parser is bundled with JDOM. However, it can work with equally well with any SAX2 compliant parser.

A JDOM tree is fully read-write. All parts of the tree can be moved, deleted and added to. Unlike DOM, there're no annoying read-only sections of the tree you can't change.

Method Detail

save

public boolean save(java.net.URI xml,
                    java.net.URI xsd,
                    java.util.List<GeneratedArtefact> collection)
serializes the generated test data collection to the given path. It builds an in-memory XML document first based on the JDOM technology. Then the whole XML file is written out as XML. The success of the process, building the XML and saving is indicated by a flag which is returned. If true has been returned to the invoker everything is gone fine, otherwise false indicates that something is gone bad. In the latter case no physical XML file exists.

Parameters:
xml - the path of the test data collection to save to. The collection is based on XML syntax.
xsd - the corresponding XSD file of XML file.
collection - the generated test data sets
Returns:
true, if successful
